text: Petäjävesi (; lit. "pine water") is a municipality of Finland. It is located in the province of Western Finland, next to the city of Jyväskylä, and is part of the Central Finland region. The municipality has a population of () and covers an area of of which is water. The population density is . Neighbouring municipalities are Jyväskylä, Jämsä, Keuruu, Multia and Uurainen. The municipality is unilingually Finnish. The Petäjävesi Old Church, was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994 for its testimony to Nordic church architecture. ==Nature== There are all together 99 lakes in Petäjävesi. The biggest lakes are Jämsänvesi-Petäjävesi, Ala-Kintaus and Ylä-Kintaus. Karikkoselkä is a lake in Petäjävesi, which is formed by a meteorite. The Karikkoselkä impact crater is located southeast of the municipal centre. ==Notable people== *Frans Lehtonen (1859–1920) *Olavi Tupamäki (1944–) *Jarmo Kytölehto (1961–) ==Gallery== File:Petäjävesi Old Church interior pulpit choir.JPG|Petäjävesi Old Church interior File:Petäjävesi - church2.jpg|Petäjävesi New Church File:Petajavesi Old Church.jpg|Petäjävesi Old Church ==References== ==External links== * Municipality of Petäjävesi – Official website, finnish, english Category:Populated places established in 1868
title: Petäjävesi
